t: Then*p Jonah prayed to the Lord*s his God from the fish’s belly.
And he said: “I*pn cried out to the Lord*s because of my affliction, And*ld He answered me. “Out*ln of the belly of Sheol I cried, And*ild You heard my voice.
For*ld You cast me into the deep, Into*ld the heart of the seas, And*ld the floods surrounded me; All*ld Your billows and Your waves passed over me.
Then*ld I said, ‘I have been cast out of Your sight; Yet*ld I will look again toward Your holy temple.’
The*ld waters surrounded me, even*i to my soul; The*ld deep closed around me; Weeds*ld were wrapped around my head.
I*ld went down to the moorings of the mountains; The*ld earth with its bars closed*i behind me forever; Yet*ld You have brought up my life from the pit, O*ld Lord,*s my God.
“When*ln my soul fainted within me, I*ld remembered the Lord;*s And*ld my prayer went up*i to You, Into*ld Your holy temple.
“Those*ln who regard worthless idols Forsake*ld their own Mercy.
But*ld I will sacrifice to You With*ld the voice of thanksgiving; I*ld will pay what I have vowed. Salvation*ld is*i of the Lord.”*s
So*p the Lord*s spoke to the fish, and it vomited Jonah onto dry land.*i
